result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A Marquard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees by 01-24-2019 or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
STRAIGHT TIME. GOOD TIME TO APPLY. Credit for 72 days.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never possess a firearm or body armor and his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Signature Bond Reinstated 08/30/2016 $750.00

Defendant Scott A Marquard in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdh

Sentencing hearing from 01-24-2017 RECALLED.

Court ordered Defendant eligible for Expungement on 01-24-2017.  Defendant is statutorily barred from expungement.  Court VACATED the expungement order from the Sentencing entry of 01-24-2017.  All other conditions of Sentencing from 01-24-2017 are to remain the same with the exception of expungement.  Matter is REMOVED from the Court's calendar as of this date.

Defendant Scott A Marquard in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Scott A Marquard in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve FOUR (4) MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for SEVENTY-TWO (72) DAYS time served.  STRAIGHT TIME.  GOOD TIME TO APPLY.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees BY 01-24-2019 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law WITHIN THREE (3) YEARS, upon submission of motion.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Scott A Marquard in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Scott A Marquard in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense advised that there is a basis for the REVOCATION,  however Defendant is acknowledging his mistakes.  Defendant acknowledged that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  DEFENDANT IS REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT DATE.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 24, 2017 at 10:00 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

10/18/16. er

Defendant Scott A Marquard in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Scott A Marquard in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant was unable to attend the hearing at which the Warrant was issued due to being in custody in a different County.  Court went off the Record to allow Counsel time to confer.  Hearing continued on the Record.  Court advised Counsel of the reason a cash bail was set.  Defense moved to have a lower cash bail with turnover to JusticePoint for supervision.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned for ONE (1) WEEK to establish whether or not JusticePoint will accept the Defendant back on monitoring.  Review hearing scheduled for October 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
IF POSTED, TURNOVER TO JUSTICEPOINT FOR SUPERVISION.
(1).  (EMAIL).  From JusticePoint Case Manager.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Scott A Marquard in court with attorney Paul David Langer.  Defendant Scott A Marquard in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant was scheduled for Review at the last hearing.  Defense advised that Defendant was contagious at the last hearing.  Defendant had attempted to FAX a Medical excuse to the Court, however that FAX was NOT received.  Defense advised that Defendant was to VOLUNTARILY turn himself in, however Defendant was picked up on charges in a different County.  State advised that Defendant was UNABLE to appear in this County due to the cases in the TWO (2) other counties.  Defense advised that the TWO (2) new Felony bail jumping cases arose from the Defendant not being able to appear before Milwaukee County.  State moved to REMAND the Defendant pending locating a monitoring agency.  Defense afvised that Defendant has posted Bail in one County and is released on a PR BOND in the other County.  Defense requested that a moderate Cash bail be set.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defense moved to WITHDRAW.  After examination,  Court allowed Defendant to WITHDRAW.  OSPD is aware of the withdrawal and will assess the Defendant for eligibility.  Review hearing scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
(FAX).  Copy of Medical excuse.  Filed, sdg.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Paul David Langer in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that he and the Defendant were present at Staffing LAST WEEK (09-27-2016).  Defense advised that Defendant tested POSITIVE after Staffing.  Defense advised that he asked Defendant to have a medical excuse faxed to the Court.  Clerk provided Defense with the fax number.  Defense advised that Defendant said that a report was faxed YESTERDAY (09-26-2016).  No fax has been received as of this hearing (08:50 am on 09-27-2016).  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Scott A Marquard in court with attorney Paul David Langer.  Defendant Scott A Marquard in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that the DA's Office does not have a problem continuing the DPA.  State did not disagree.  State advised that Defendant now has TWO (2) other charges in TWO (2) different Counties.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant advised that he went through detox after the Warrant was issued at the last hearing and that he has been clean since that date.  Defense advised that he has spoken with JusticePoint and they will CONSIDER working with the Defendant.  Defense advised that Defendant is gainfully employed at the time.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for September 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant was NOT produced.  Matter is ADJOURNED to 08-30-2016 at 10:00 am.  DA to provide OTP & R.  sdg

Defendant absconded after being told that he would need to report to JusticePoint before the hearing.  Defense moved to WITHDRAW.  Court did not allow Defense to withdraw at this time due to Defendant's non-appearance.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Attorney Paul David Langer in court, defendant Scott A Marquard not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant has cases pending in Waukesha and Washington Counties.  State is willing to extend a deferred prosecution agreement.   Justice Point is willing to accept the defendant.   Court sets bail at $1,500 cash TOT Justice Point with the same conditions including: 1) no illegally controlled substances; 2) random screening; 3) make all court hearings.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott A Marquard in court.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears in Court without Counsel.  Defendant is not Public Defender eligible. Case in court for indigency hearing. Court held colloquy regarding finances with the defendant. Court stated that the defendant needs to hire an attorney. Defendant stated that he needs more time to hire an attorney. Court ordered a status of counsel date before the Judge in two weeks, at which the Court specified the hired attorney should be present. Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg. Case adjourned to Branch 03.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Indigency hearing scheduled for 07-20-2015 at 08:30 am.
